value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - Model Performance Tuning in DAX Studio - By Marco Russo
value.excerpt: DAX Studio is the tool for data model tuning.  Marco Russo contributor to DAX Studio will be giving us a deep dive and demo around using DAX Studio for Model Performance Tuning.   You will not want to miss this event as Marco is a wealth of knowledge for all things Data Modeling!  Watch the Full Tutorial

value.title: Create a subset of the table in Power BI and add calculations using SELECTCOLUMNS DAX Function

value.title: Power BI Date or Calendar Table Best Method   DAX or Power Query
value.excerpt: So you want to create a date or calendar table in Power BI, and you search for ways to do that. Then you will find many different approaches for that. Some of the approaches are using Power Query, some are using DAX. Which method is the best? What is the actual difference between a date table created

value.title: Power BI DAX RelatedTable Function   Get the subtable related to the current row
value.excerpt: There are multiple functions that can help when you work with tables that are connected through relationships. One of these functions is Relatedtable. This function gives you the subtable from the other table for all the rows related to the current row. For example, all sales transactions (from the Sales
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZrhnliV7Jrw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI HR Pattern   DAX Measures for the Last Position to Date   Last Status to Date
value.excerpt: One of the common patterns in Power BI is to have a table with different statuses throughout time and then wanting to get the latest status up to a selected date. A simple example of that is to have a table with position(role) changes of employees and then wanting to see their latest position based on

value.title: Previous Dynamic Period using DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Parallel Period is a function that helps you fetching the previous period of a Month, Quarter, or Year. value.title: Writing calculations on a real time streaming Power BI dataset using DAX measures
value.excerpt: In the previous article and video, I explained a method that you can use to have real-time calculations in a Power BI streaming dataset. The calculations done that way are limited though because it is using the Q&A feature of Power BI. If you are after a complex calculation then DAX can definitely help.

value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: How to debug a DAX measure

value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Tabular models (including Power BI) require marking the Date table as a date table to get appropriate results with time intelligence calculations. This video explains why this setting is required. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670749

value.title: Sorting months in fiscal calendars in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows a basic technique used to sort months according to a fiscal calendar, by using a couple of calculated columns and the “sort by column” feature of Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/492713?aff=yt

value.title: Understanding Performance Analyzer metrics in DAX Studio

value.title: Understanding the IN operator in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn the IN operator in DAX, which simplifies logical conditions by checking whether a certain value belongs to a list of values. Article and download: {short_related_link}?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX
value.excerpt: Time intelligence functions oftentimes hide an automatic ALL statement meant to make time intelligence calculations easier. This video describes this behavior and what to do in case it ends up breaking your calculation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/123591

value.title: Build a P&L in Power BI Without Any DAX
value.excerpt: This is the third article where I have covered building a P&L in Power BI. My first 2 articles here and here focused on how to use the DAX language to solve some of the common problems with P&L reporting, such as adding sub totals into the visual, % of [...]Read More »

value.title: Introduction to Power BI and DAX
value.excerpt: Back in 2019 I ran a free webinar introducing Power BI and DAX. Many readers of my blog will already be well ahead of this topic, but then again many of you also probably run into people who would benefits from a simple introduction. I have decided to publish the [...]Read More »

value.title: Looking for a great introduction to DAX?
When to use Power Query/M vs Data Modelling/DAX
value.excerpt: Ken Puls and I decided we would do a live stream chat to talk about a topic of interest to Power BI people.  We put out a survey and 75% of the respondents wanted to hear about “when to use Power Query/M vs Data Modelling/DAX”.  It’s a really interesting topic [...]Read More »
